member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.SignalR.HubException
member.summary: The exception thrown from a hub when an error occurs.
member.remarks: Exceptions often contain sensitive information, such as connection information. Because of this, SignalR does not expose the details of exceptions that occur on the server to the client. However, instances of are sent to the client.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.SignalR.HubException.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.SignalR.HubException.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a specified error message.
member.param: The error message that explains the reason for the exception.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.SignalR.HubException.#ctor(System.String,System.Exception)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a specified error message and a reference to the inner exception that is the cause of this exception.
member.param: The error message that explains the reason for the exception.
The exception that is the cause of the current exception, or null if no inner exception is specified.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.SignalR.HubException.#ctor(System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo,System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The that holds the serialized object data about the exception being thrown.
The that contains contextual information about the source or destination.
member.exception: The class name is null or is zero (0).

member.summary: If , clients with automatic reconnects enabled should not attempt to automatically reconnect after receiving the .

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with an optional error message and set to .

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.SignalR.Protocol.CloseMessage.#ctor(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with an optional error message and a indicating whether or not a client with automatic reconnects enabled should attempt to reconnect upon receiving the message.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.SignalR.Protocol.CompletionMessage
member.summary: Represents an invocation that has completed. If there is an error then the invocation didn't complete successfully.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.SignalR.Protocol.CompletionMessage.Error
member.summary: Optional error message if the invocation wasn't completed successfully. This must be null if there is a result.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.SignalR.Protocol.CompletionMessage.Result
member.summary: Optional result from the invocation. This must be null if there is an error. This can also be null if there wasn't a result from the method invocation.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.SignalR.Protocol.CompletionMessage.HasResult
member.summary: Specifies whether the completion contains a result.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.SignalR.Protocol.CompletionMessage.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.Object,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Constructs a .
member.param: The ID of the invocation that has completed.
An optional error if the invocation failed.
An optional result if the invocation returns a result.
Specifies whether the completion contains a result.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.SignalR.Protocol.CompletionMessage.WithError(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Constructs a with an error.
member.param: The ID of the invocation that is being completed.
The error that occurred during the invocation.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.SignalR.Protocol.CompletionMessage.WithResult(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Constructs a with a result.
member.param: The ID of the invocation that is being completed.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.SignalR.Protocol.CompletionMessage.Empty(System.String)
member.summary: Constructs a without an error or result. This means the invocation was successful but there is no return value.
member.param: The ID of the invocation that is being completed.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.SignalR.Protocol.InvocationBindingFailureMessage
member.summary: Represents a failure to bind arguments for an invocation. This does not represent an actual message that is sent on the wire, it is returned by to indicate that a binding failure occurred when parsing an invocation. The invocation ID is associated so that the error can be sent back to the client, associated with the appropriate invocation ID.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.SignalR.Protocol.InvocationBindingFailureMessage.BindingFailure
member.summary: Gets the exception thrown during binding.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.SignalR.Protocol.InvocationBindingFailureMessage.Target
member.summary: Gets the target method name.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.SignalR.Protocol.InvocationBindingFailureMessage.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.Runtime.ExceptionServices.ExceptionDispatchInfo)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.SignalR.Protocol.PingMessage
member.summary: A keep-alive message to let the other side of the connection know that the connection is still alive.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AspNetCore.SignalR.Protocol.PingMessage.Instance
member.summary: A static instance of the PingMessage to remove unneeded allocations.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.SignalR.Protocol.StreamBindingFailureMessage
member.summary: Represents a failure to bind arguments for a StreamDataMessage. This does not represent an actual message that is sent on the wire, it is returned by to indicate that a binding failure occurred when parsing a StreamDataMessage. The stream ID is associated so that the error can be sent to the relevant hub method.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.SignalR.Protocol.StreamBindingFailureMessage.Id
member.summary: Gets the id of the relevant stream

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.SignalR.Protocol.StreamBindingFailureMessage.BindingFailure
member.summary: Gets the exception thrown during binding.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Holds a byte[] from the pool and a size value. Basically a Memory but guaranteed to be backed by an ArrayPool byte[], so that we know we can return it.
